title: Concert for a princess
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + On Aug 29, the "Heavenly Voices For The Princess Concert" will be performed by the Viola Lovers band under the baton of Asst Prof Col Chuchart Pitaksakorn at 4.30pm at Samosorn Sevakamart Hall, Mrigadayavan Palace, in Cha-am district, Phetchaburi. 
Samosorn Sevakamart Hall, Mrigadayavan Palace. 
The aim is to celebrate the 90th birthday of the late HRH Princess Bejaratana Rajasuda, the only child of King Rama VI. The overture will be played by the palace's classical Thai band. Songs will include Duang Jai and San Rak , composed by King Rama VI. Admission is free. Call Mrigadayavan Palace Foundation on 090-954-5000 . Merit-making in Phuket 
From Aug 26-Sept 12, the "Phor Tor" Festival or the Chinese merit-making ceremony for ancestors will be held at various venues in Muang district, Phuket province. 
This festival formerly called ullamphon begins on the Full Moon day of the 7th Chinese lunar month -- the day the Chinese believe that spirits are released to return to visit their relatives temporarily. The Chinese decorate altars and prepare food, tea and liquor for the spirits of their ancestors inside their houses and those for wandering spirits behind their houses. 
The ceremony will be performed at Thai Hua Museum on Krabi Road on Aug 26 and Sept 2, at Jo Su Gong Shrine on Surin Circle on Aug 28, at Phor Tor Talat Nua on Aug 29, at Phor Tor Talad Sod on Ranong Road on Aug 30-31, at Chao Phor To Gong Shrine at Ban Bang Nieo during Sept 1-12 and at Phor Tor Ao Kae on Takua Pa Road on Sept 3. Call the Tourism Authority of Thailand's Phuket office on 076-211-036 . Exhibitions at airports 
Until the year-end, the "World On A Bike" Exhibition and "Bicycle Wind" Photo Exhibition will be on view at 31 airports nationwide. 
The first venue is near Entrance 4 opposite the check-in counters of Thai Airways International at Suvarnabhumi International Airport. The next venues will be Chiang Mai airport, Mae Fah Luang Chiang Rai airport, Hat Yai airport, Phuket airport and 26 other airports. 
The objectives are to tell the inspiring stories of people who try to beat obstacles, fulfil dreams and make friends on cycling journeys. Displayed on a rice paddy-shaped metal frame, the exhibition shows a world atlas, details of cycling routes in 43 countries in six continents, photos taken there and two bicycles used during those journeys. Call the TAT Contact Centre 1672 . Rubber boat rides 
Until the end of October, the "Tasting Kaeng Song Coffee, Travelling along the Khek Stream" festival will take place on the Khek waterway from Ban Sap Praiwan to Kaeng Song Waterfall in Wang Thong district, Phitsanulok province. 
Visitors can enjoy rubber boat rides past 18 rapids for 8km, which takes a few hours. The level of difficulty ranges from one to five. Also, there will be garbage collection rides. Call Phitsanulok Rapid Adventure Club on 055-293-338 or 087-210-3843. Cycling in the Northeast 
From Oct 29-Nov 1, the "Ride to Khong's Legend" cycling contest will take place on the Nong Khai-Bung Kan-Nakhon Phanom-Mukdahan-Phu Manorom route covering over 300km. Visit www.thaifest.com or call the TAT on 02-250-5500 ext 3470/3 .
